item.title: Charissa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Matthew Arnold
item.description:
"Ah, love, let us be true To one another! for the world, which seems To lie before us like a land of dreams, So various, so beautiful, so new, Hath really neither joy, nor love, nor light,
Nor certitude, nor peace, nor help for pain; And we are here as on a darkling plain Swept with confused alarms of struggle and flight, Where ignorant armies clash by night." -- Matthew Arnold

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Trey Parker
item.description: "The most punk-rock thing you can do in L.A. is to say ‘George Bush is fucking awesome’ instead of talking about how lame it is that he’s fighting for oil." -- Trey Parker

item.title: Charissa add a quote by David Shrigley
item.description: "Sorry I painted the word 'twat' on your garage door." -- David Shrigley

item.title: Charissa add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "If I make the lashes dark And the eyes more bright And the lips more scarlet, Or ask if all be right From mirror after mirror, No vanity's displayed: I'm looking for the face I had Before the world was made." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "God doesn’t need to punish us. He just grants us a long enough life to punish ourselves." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Ram Dass
item.description: "We're all just walking each other home." -- Ram Dass

item.title: Charissa add a quote by Quentin R. Bufogle
item.description: "As with most things, my approach to writing has been entirely ass-backwards. I first had to become everything but a writer -- exhaust all possibilities. I had to come to it on my knees. Only when there was truly nothing left, was I able to become a writer." -- Quentin R. Bufogle
